<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><A NAME="rom41104_11"></A>Executive Compensation Highlights </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:5.5pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:2.00pt solid #821928">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Compensation Philosophy
</I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="92%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="29%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="69%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt" BGCOLOR="#821928">
<TD HEIGHT="5" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="5" COLSPAN="2" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#821928" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt"><FONT COLOR="#ffffff"><B><FONT COLOR="#ffffff">Philosophy</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt"><FONT COLOR="#ffffff"><B><FONT COLOR="#ffffff">Key Components</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" ROWSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt" BGCOLOR="#f4f7f7"> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Our executive compensation philosophy is designed to deliver competitive total compensation, upon the achievement of individual and business performance objectives,
which will attract, motivate and retain leaders who will drive the creation of stockholder value.</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt"> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Target total compensation is based on the median of our peer group and relevant external market data. Actual compensation is determined by achievement of results based
on our goals aligned to ITW&#146;s Enterprise Strategy.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt"> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Individual executive compensation is then established based on an executive&#146;s scope of responsibility, impact on profitable growth, individual performance and
breadth of experience.</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">Pay-for-performance through short- and long-term incentives links compensation to Company and business segment performance. This
&#147;pay-at-risk&#148; aligns executive and stockholder interests to help ensure the short- and long-term growth and health of ITW.</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">25 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Compensation Objectives </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">We emphasize a total compensation approach in establishing individual executive compensation levels with each element of compensation serving a specific purpose. In
addition to paying a competitive base salary, we use a mix of different performance-based elements of compensation that reward different aspects of both Company and individual performance. Our 2015 executive compensation program consists primarily
of three compensation elements: fixed (base salary), variable (annual cash incentives and long-term incentive compensation including stock options, performance-based restricted stock units (PRSUs) and performance cash awards), and retirement and
change-in-control benefits, as illustrated below: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><I>2015 Compensation Elements </I></B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="16%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="31%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="26%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#821928" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" BGCOLOR="#821928"><FONT COLOR="#ffffff"><B>Compensation<BR>Element</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#821928" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" BGCOLOR="#821928"><FONT COLOR="#ffffff"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Form&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#821928" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" BGCOLOR="#821928"><FONT COLOR="#ffffff"><B>Objective</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#821928" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt" BGCOLOR="#821928"><FONT COLOR="#ffffff"><B>Alignment&nbsp;of&nbsp;Stockholder&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;<BR>Value Creation</B></FONT></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt"><FONT STYLE="font-size:10pt"><B>FIXED</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center">Base Salary</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000">Cash</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL">Market competitive to attract and retain highly qualified leaders</P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL">Reflective of individual performance, experience and scope of responsibility</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="middle" ROWSPAN="4" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt">
<P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>VARIABLE</B></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">Annual&nbsp;Executive</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">Incentive Plan</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">(&#147;EIP&#148;)</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">Cash</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">Motivate executives to achieve annual Company and business segment performance</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">For 2015, focused on diluted income per share from continuing operations (&#147;EPS&#148;), business segment
operating income growth and individual objectives designed to deliver strategic business imperatives</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">Stock Options</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">Equity</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ROWSPAN="3"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL">Long-term decisions that focus on long-term stockholder value</P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL">Reward executives for delivering on the Company&#146;s long-term performance goals</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">Award value based on sustained long-term growth in ITW stock</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">Performance-based RSUs (&#147;PRSUs&#148;)</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">Equity</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">Use EPS metric and payout based on sustained long-term growth in ITW stock price</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center">Long-Term Incentive Cash (&#147;LTI Cash&#148;)</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000">Cash</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">Financial metrics align with ITW&#146;s Enterprise Strategy and progress towards the Company&#146;s stated long-term performance goals</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="middle" ROWSPAN="3" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>RETIREMENT</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>AND</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">CHANGE-IN</FONT> -</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>CONTROL</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center"><B>BENEFITS</B></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">Savings &amp; Investment</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">Plan-401(k)</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">Cash</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ROWSPAN="2" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL">Retirement savings in both qualified and nonqualified plans aligned
with market practices</P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL">Nonqualified plan allows contributions for those exceeding the IRS
limits</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ROWSPAN="2" VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Plan</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">Cash</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">Change-in-Control Severance Policy</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">Cash/</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">Equity</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">Provides compensation in the event of a termination after a change-in-control</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">Allows senior executives to make decisions in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">26 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Ongoing Best Practices </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">We regularly review and refine our executive compensation program to ensure that it continues to reflect practices and policies that are aligned with our
pay-for-performance philosophy and the interests of our stockholders. In this regard, our 2015 compensation program reflects the following: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="46%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="45%"></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#821928" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="3" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt"><FONT COLOR="#ffffff"><B><FONT COLOR="#ffffff">What We Do</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="3" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt"><FONT COLOR="#ffffff"><B><FONT COLOR="#ffffff">What We Don&#146;t
Do</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.40em; text-indent:-2.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#252;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">We maintain a Compensation Recovery Policy (&#147;clawback policy&#148;) requiring the reimbursement of incentives if a material financial restatement is required</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2.40em; text-indent:-2.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#251;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:2.40em; text-indent:-2.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">We do not provide executives with employment agreements</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.40em; text-indent:-2.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#252;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">We have stock ownership guidelines linking the interests of long-term stockholders to our executives and mitigating compensation-related risk</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">
<P STYLE="margin-left:2.40em; text-indent:-2.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#251;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">We do not provide perquisites or gross ups as part of our change-in-control agreements</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.40em; text-indent:-2.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#252;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">The Compensation Committee engages an independent compensation consultant who advises the Committee on regulatory and other current trends and key developments in executive compensation</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">
<P STYLE="margin-left:2.40em; text-indent:-2.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#251;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">We do not allow share repricing within our stock option plan</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.40em; text-indent:-2.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#252;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">We conduct an annual review of the performance of the CEO as well as the other NEOs</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">
<P STYLE="margin-left:2.40em; text-indent:-2.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#251;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">We prohibit officers, directors, and employees from hedging, making new pledges, short selling or publicly trading options involving ITW
common stock</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.40em; text-indent:-2.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#252;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">We hold an annual advisory vote for our stockholders to review and approve our executive compensation programs</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">
<P STYLE="margin-left:2.40em; text-indent:-2.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#251;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">We do not allow immediate vesting of equity awards that are continued or replaced upon a change-in-control; all such awards allow only
double-trigger vesting (change-in-control and termination)</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Say On Pay Voting Results </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Committee considered the 96.9% approval by our stockholders of the compensation of our NEOs in 2015, and determined that no particular adjustments to our executive
compensation practices were necessary as a result of the Say on Pay vote. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Overview of Key Compensation Decisions </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The following describes significant actions and changes to our executive compensation practices for the NEOs. We believe these practices reflect good corporate
governance in our compensation policies while continuing to recognize and reward superior Company, business segment and individual performance. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Annual Executive Incentive Plan (&#147;EIP&#148;) </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT></SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">The EIP awards for 2015 were based 80% on the Financial Performance Component and 20% on Individual Objectives, which is consistent with the prior year&#146;s annual incentive plan design. The 2015 Financial Performance
Component for corporate executives was based 100% on Company EPS performance and for operating executives was based 50% on Company EPS and 50% on the operating income of their respective business segments. The payout range of the EIP is 0% to 200%
of target. In 2015, EIP was earned at an average of 116% of target for the NEOs. </TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">27 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT></SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">For 2016, we are changing the performance measures for EIP by eliminating the Individual Objectives component. Instead, EIP awards in 2016 will be based solely on the achievement of financial results, including
operating income (60% of the target) and organic revenue growth (40% of the target), which are two critical financial performance metrics aligned with ITW&#146;s next phase Enterprise Strategy performance goals. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman">&#9679;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><B>Long-Term Incentives </B> </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT></SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Weightings of the long-term incentive award components in 2015 remained the same as 2014. The weighting for the CEO was 40% stock options, 30% PRSUs and 30% LTI Cash, and the weighting for the other NEOs was one-third
each for stock options, PRSUs and LTI Cash. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT></SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">The financial measures for the 2015-2017 LTI Cash award remained the same as 2014. The weighting of the financial measures for this performance period is one-third for each of the following financial metrics: operating
margin; ROIC; and organic revenue growth. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT></SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">PRSUs for the 2013-2015 performance period were earned at 100% of target, and LTI Cash for the 2013-2015 performance period was earned at 91% of target. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT></SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">With organic revenue growth becoming a key component of EIP for 2016, EPS will now be a performance measure in the 3-year LTI Cash plan. The long-term incentive metrics for the 2016 LTI Cash plan will be EPS, operating
margin, and ROIC, with each of the three metrics equally weighted. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>2015 Target Compensation </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Our target total compensation (base salary, EIP, and long-term incentives) is intended to create a strong correlation between the executive&#146;s compensation and
enterprise and/or business segment performance. The compensation elements based on corporate or business segment performance include EIP, LTI Cash and equity incentives. Ninety-one percent of 2015 total compensation for the CEO is tied to
performance, with 54% in the form of equity and 37% performance cash awards. Eighty-one percent of 2015 total compensation for the other NEOs (on average) is tied to performance, with 42% delivered through equity awards and 39% in the form of
performance cash awards. Our equity and long-term cash awards have multi-year vesting schedules to align the interests of our executive officers with the long-term interests of our stockholders. The following charts illustrate the allocation of our
target total compensation opportunity for 2015 between fixed (base salary) and variable (EIP and long-term incentives) components. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:24pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="84%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="50%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">


<IMG SRC="g41104g31l18.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">


<IMG SRC="g41104g45o38.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Total target compensation as used in the charts above is the sum of base salary, target EIP and the grant date fair value of LTI Cash
and equity incentives. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">28 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><A NAME="rom41104_12"></A>How We Make Compensation Decisions </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:2.00pt solid #821928">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Role of the Compensation
Committee </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Committee conducts an annual review of ITW&#146;s practices and the compensation of our executive officers to ensure: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">The elements of the total compensation package are aligned with the market to attract and retain the caliber of talent required to deliver on our business strategies; </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Compensation decisions are meaningfully differentiated to appropriately reflect the contributions of our highest performers; and </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Our incentive programs drive performance aligned with our Enterprise Strategy and the Company&#146;s culture and values. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In making its executive compensation decisions and recommendations, the Committee is guided by the following factors: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Our compensation philosophy; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Compensation comparisons from a peer group of diversified multinational industrial companies with similar size, value, and complexity; and </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Management&#146;s contribution to our short- and long-term goals based on profitable growth and strong returns on capital. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In addition, the Committee engaged an independent advisor, Frederic W. Cook&nbsp;&amp; Co., Inc. (&#147;Cook&#148;), to work directly on its behalf and in cooperation
with management to review ITW&#146;s executive compensation program, confirm appropriateness of our peer companies, and assess our compensation governance process. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">See &#147;Board of Directors and Its Committees &#151; Compensation Committee&#148; under <A HREF="#rom41104_2">&#147;Proposal&nbsp;1&nbsp;&#151;Election&nbsp;
of Directors</A>&#148; for more information about the function of the Compensation Committee. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Role of the Compensation Consultant
</I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">As previously stated, the Committee has engaged Cook as its independent compensation consultant. In 2015, Cook conducted a marketplace review of the
compensation we pay to our executive officers. Cook provided the Committee with relevant market data, including a review of our pay and performance and that of our peers, reviewed the peer companies we use for comparison purposes, and benchmarked
our compensation against our peer companies. Cook also assisted the Committee with its assessment of compensation-related risk. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Based on its consideration of
factors under NYSE listing standards, the Committee concluded that the work performed by Cook and its senior advisor involved in the engagement did not raise any conflict of interest. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Risk Assessment </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Committee, together
with management and our independent compensation consultant, annually considers potential risks when reviewing our compensation programs for all employees, including our executive officers. Based on this assessment, the Committee concluded that our
2015 compensation programs do not create risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on ITW. In making this determination, the Committee reviewed the key design elements of our compensation programs, as well as the means by
which any potential risks may be mitigated. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">29 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Peer Companies </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2%; text-indent:-2%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Committee has identified a group of comparable companies, which we refer to as the peer group, </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">to benchmark executive compensation and provide </P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="50%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">competitive market data to be used in establishing and recommending each element of compensation. The peer group is reviewed annually by the Committee
with assistance from Cook. In addition, the Committee refers to market data based on manufacturing companies within the Aon Hewitt TCM Online Executive survey using regression analysis and tabular long-term incentive data and Mercer Executive
Compensation survey with a revenue range of $5 billion to $20 billion for corporate executives and $1.2 billion to $1.375 billion for the operating executives.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2.00pt solid #821928; BORDER-TOP:2.00pt solid #821928">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2.00pt solid #821928; BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #821928; padding-right:8pt"> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.80em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Peer&nbsp;Group&nbsp;Selection&nbsp;Criteria:</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.20em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;U.S. publicly traded companies from ITW&#146;s same and related industries, identified based on
Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s Global Industry Classification Standard (GICS) codes;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.20em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Companies with one-fourth to four times our revenue and market cap with broadly similar businesses and
pay models;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.20em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Companies that
compete for the same customers with similar products and/or services; and</P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom">In connection with its annual review in 2015, the Committee removed TRW Automotive from the</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2.00pt solid #821928; BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #821928">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #821928; BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #821928; padding-right:8pt">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.20em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Companies with whom we may compete for executive talent.</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:4pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Company&#146;s peer group as it was acquired by ZF Friedrichshafen AG and is no longer a free-standing public company. In addition, the
Committee added Stanley Black&nbsp;&amp; Decker in consideration of the company meeting the recommended size criteria, listing ITW as a peer, and its inclusion in ITW&#146;s Institutional Stockholder Services peer group. For 2015, the Committee
identified the following 19 companies to be used as the Company&#146;s peer group:</P> <P STYLE="font-size:4pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="89.6%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="22%"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom">Textron Inc.</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">At the time of the Committee&#146;s review, the revenue median of the peer group was $19.6 billion based on the latest four quarters, and
the median market cap was $31.2 billion, versus $14.3 billion and $34.5 billion, respectively, for ITW. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The nature of our decentralized and diverse lines of
business presents challenges in identifying similar organizations for comparison purposes; however, we believe that the peer group selected provides relevant comparisons. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Compensation Decisions and Individual Compensation Levels </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">On an annual basis, the CEO reviews the total compensation of the executive officers and makes recommendations to the Committee based on his assessment of each
executive&#146;s individual performance and the peer group compensation information. The Committee makes recommendations to the independent directors regarding the CEO&#146;s compensation based on an assessment of the CEO&#146;s performance and
market data. There are no material differences in the policies and decision processes used in setting compensation for the CEO and the other NEOs. However, the different levels of compensation for the NEOs as shown in the Summary Compensation Table
of this proxy statement reflect internal factors such as each executive&#146;s scope of responsibility, impact on profitable growth and breadth of experience, as well as external market data from the peer group. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">30 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><A NAME="rom41104_13"></A>Components of the 2015 Executive Compensation Program </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:2.00pt solid #821928">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Base Salary </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In determining base salary, the CEO and the Committee consider the size and scope of the executive officers&#146; responsibilities, experience, performance, and the
median base salary of similar positions at our peer group companies. The Committee believes that median base salary is an appropriate general reference point to use for encouraging solid performance. Base salaries are reviewed annually, and
adjustments are intended to recognize performance and contributions over the prior year, as well as any significant changes in duties or scope of responsibility. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In
February 2015, the Compensation Committee reviewed Mr.&nbsp;Santi&#146;s performance and approved a base salary increase to $1,166,000 from $1,100,000 (6%). For the other NEOs, the Committee approved recommended base pay increases that ranged
between 3.8% and 6%. These base salary increases were effective March&nbsp;2, 2015. Effective August&nbsp;7, 2015, Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Herlihy was promoted to Vice Chairman and received a base salary increase of 20.8% to $610,000 and an EIP target bonus
change from 80% to 90%. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Annual Executive Incentive Plan </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">We believe that executives generally should be rewarded for contributions to overall financial success measured by income growth of the Company as a whole and, if
applicable, the business segment he or she leads. Achieving our annual financial objectives is important to executing our current Enterprise Strategy objectives and delivering long-term value to stockholders. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Committee determines and recommends for approval by the independent directors the annual incentive award amount for the CEO. The Committee considers recommendations
from the CEO and approves EIP awards for our other NEOs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">For 2015, the EIP was composed of two elements for our NEOs: Financial Performance Component (80%)&nbsp;and
Individual Objectives (20%). The Financial Performance Component weighting for the CEO, Vice Chairmen, and CFO was based 100% on year-over-year growth in EPS to be aligned with our stockholders&#146; interests. For operating executives, the
weighting of the Financial Performance Component was based 50% on EPS performance and 50% on the business segment&#146;s operating income growth. These weightings are intended to emphasize financial performance while also reinforcing the operating
executive&#146;s support for Company-wide strategy and objectives. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Financial Performance Component was recommended by management and approved by the Committee
at the start of the 2015 performance year. The Individual Objectives for the CEO were established by the Committee, and the Individual Objectives for each of the other NEOs were recommended by the CEO and also approved by the Committee at the start
of the 2015 performance year. The Committee has the discretion to make adjustments in the calculation of financial performance to eliminate factors beyond the control of management and to eliminate possible disincentives to act in the long-term best
interests of the Company and our stockholders. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">31 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

January&nbsp;1, 2015 through August&nbsp;6, 2015, and from August&nbsp;7, 2015 through December&nbsp;31, 2015, was based 100% on Company EPS. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><I>2015 EIP Individual Objectives </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In early 2015, each NEO prepared his
proposed Individual Objectives. Each NEO, other than Mr.&nbsp;Santi, discussed his proposed objectives and weightings with Mr.&nbsp;Santi, who used his judgment of each executive&#146;s role and responsibilities, as well as the strategic goals of
the Company, to review and approve the objectives before recommending them to the Committee. The Committee reviewed these recommendations with Mr.&nbsp;Santi prior to final approval. Mr.&nbsp;Santi discussed his proposed Individual Objectives for
2015 directly with the Committee. The Committee used its judgment and understanding of the strategic goals of the Company to review and approve the Individual Objectives for Mr.&nbsp;Santi for 2015. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Individual Objectives for Mr.&nbsp;Santi and the other NEOs that were approved by the Committee include: (1)&nbsp;begin to transition the Company to focus on organic
revenue growth; (2)&nbsp;continue to enhance the quality of ITW Business Model practice across the Company; (3)&nbsp;continue the strong execution of Enterprise Strategy initiatives; and (4)&nbsp;successfully implement talent management initiatives.
</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">32 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Following the end of the year, each NEO submitted a written self-appraisal with his assessment of his achievement of these
objectives. Mr.&nbsp;Santi reviewed the self-appraisals of the NEOs (other than himself) and had collaborative discussions with each of these executives. Mr.&nbsp;Santi used his judgment of each NEO&#146;s performance against the objectives,
considering completion of objectives and the quality of the work performed, to reach his assessment of the overall achievement level prior to submitting his recommendations for approval by the Committee. The Committee reviewed Mr.&nbsp;Santi&#146;s
self-appraisal for 2015 and used its judgment of his performance against his objectives to reach its assessment of his overall Individual Objective achievement level. The independent directors approved the Committee&#146;s recommendation. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Based on the Committee&#146;s determination of achievement of Mr.&nbsp;Santi&#146;s 2015 Individual Objectives, and upon Mr.&nbsp;Santi&#146;s recommendations for the
other NEOs, the following Individual Objective achievement percentages were assigned: 150% for Mr.&nbsp;Santi, 150% for Mr.&nbsp;Larsen, 150% for Mr.&nbsp;Parry, 150% for Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Herlihy, and 130% for Mr.&nbsp;Martel. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><I>2015 Annual Cash Incentive Total Payouts </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The total 2015 payouts to the
NEOs ranged from 110% to 127% of target award level, and were determined as follows: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Long-Term Incentives </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="59%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="37%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top">The value of the overall long-term incentive award to the</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">CEO is determined by the Committee, subject to approval by the independent directors. Awards to the other NEOs are recommended by the CEO to the
Committee for approval.</P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The key factors in determining the awards have been the executive&#146;s
position, performance, potential to contribute to the long-term success of the Company, breadth of experience and prior awards. In addition, although we generally do not establish any specific target or prescribed value in relation to peer groups,
comparisons are made to long-term incentive levels in the peer group compensation data.</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2.00pt solid #821928; BORDER-TOP:2.00pt solid #821928; BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #821928">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2.00pt solid #821928; BORDER-RIGHT:2.00pt solid #821928; BORDER-BOTTOM:2.00pt solid #821928; padding-right:8pt">We believe that ensuring the long-term growth and profitability of the business is a primary
management responsibility. Therefore, a significant portion of an executive officer&#146;s compensation should be directly linked to key metrics that consider the long-term perspective, such as EPS, ROIC, operating margin, organic revenue growth and
ITW&#146;s stock performance over time.</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">33 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">For 2015, our NEOs received stock options, PRSUs, and LTI Cash awards. We believe that stock options are an effective
incentive because they directly align the interests of the executives with those of our stockholders, as an unexercised stock option has no realizable value if our stock price falls below the exercise price, while the value increases along with
increases in our stock price above the exercise price. The stock option awards are combined with PRSUs and LTI Cash to more closely align long-term incentives with our Enterprise Strategy objectives and increase emphasis on key financial performance
metrics. The weightings of the total target values of the 2015 long-term incentive equity and cash awards were as follows: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:15%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>2015 Long-Term
Incentive Award Weightings </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Committee has established specific vesting and expiration provisions associated with termination of employment due to death,
disability and retirement, as defined in the applicable awards, and forfeiture provisions upon other termination of employment. The Committee, in its sole discretion, may deem a long-term incentive award, whether vested or unvested, to be
immediately forfeited if the recipient competes with the Company, engages in gross misconduct or conduct that is against the business interests of the Company, or divulges confidential information about the Company to others. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><I>2015 Stock Option Awards </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The 2015 stock options vest in equal
installments over a four-year period ending in 2019. Stock options are awarded with an exercise price equal to the fair market value of the common stock on the date of grant and normally expire ten years after the award date. We currently award only
non-qualified stock options because we believe that the tax benefits to the Company of non-qualified stock options outweigh the potential tax benefits to the NEOs of incentive stock options. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><I>2015 Performance-Based RSU Awards </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">PRSUs vest three years from the date
of award, subject to the achievement of the performance goal set at the beginning of the performance period. PRSUs are awarded based on the fair market value of one share of ITW common stock on the date of award. The payout range is 10% to 100% of
the target award. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">For PRSUs awarded in 2015, the performance goal is based on cumulative EPS from continuing operations over a three-year performance period (2015
through 2017) based on a sliding scale. The target/maximum is $10.90 cumulative EPS over the three-year performance period, and the achievement of the target/maximum will result in a payout of the maximum number of shares subject to the PRSU. If
less than $8.90 cumulative EPS is achieved, none of these PRSUs will vest. If EPS growth is at or above the $8.90 threshold but below the $10.90 target/maximum, the awards will vest in proportion to the level of EPS achieved. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">34 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The goals for the 2015 LTI Cash awards are equally weighted and based on operating margin, ROIC and organic revenue growth. The payout at the end of the performance

<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B><I>2013 Long-Term Incentive Cash Award Payouts </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The LTI cash award granted
in 2013 under the Company-wide Growth Plan in effect at that time (with a three-year performance period ended December&nbsp;31, 2015) was based 40% on operating margin, 30% on ROIC and 30% on revenue growth (calculated using a simple average as
reported in our financial statements as of the time financial results for each year were publicly released). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:7%; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><B>Percentage Payout of 2013 LTI Cash
Awards </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

Incentive Awards </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Committee meets in February of each year following the Company&#146;s public release of its earnings results for the recently completed
fiscal year to consider and act with respect to long-term incentive </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">35 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
awards for the executive officers. Long-term awards are made in compliance with the Long-Term Incentive Plan, including the requirement that stock options may not be awarded at less than 100% of
the fair market value of ITW&#146;s common stock on the date of award. The exercise price of the awards is based on the closing price of ITW&#146;s stock on the date of award. We do not time awards for the purpose of enhancing the value of executive
compensation. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><A NAME="rom41104_14"></A>Executive Compensation Policies and Guidelines </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:2.00pt solid #821928">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Stock Ownership Guidelines and
Hedging Policy </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">We believe that stock ownership is important because it aligns the interests of our management and directors with those of our
stockholders. Because of the importance of stock ownership, the Board of Directors and the Committee have adopted stock ownership guidelines for executive officers and directors. Beginning in 2015, the required ownership level for the Chief
Financial Officer was increased from two times salary to three times salary. The 2015 guidelines for stock ownership as a multiple of executive officers&#146; base salaries and of directors&#146; annual retainers are as follows: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="49%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="4%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#821928" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt"><FONT COLOR="#ffffff"><B><FONT COLOR="#ffffff">Title</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt"><FONT COLOR="#ffffff"><B><FONT COLOR="#ffffff">Guideline</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Chief Executive Officer</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">6 times salary</TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#d8d8d8" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt">Vice Chairmen, Executive Vice Presidents, and Chief Financial Officer</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">3 times salary</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Senior Vice Presidents</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">2 times salary</TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#d8d8d8" STYLE="font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8pt"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Non-employee Directors</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8pt">5 times annual retainer</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Committee expects that an executive officer or non-employee director will achieve the applicable ownership level within five years.
The achievement of these guidelines is reviewed annually. The Board believes that its stock ownership guidelines are appropriate, reasonable and attainable given the responsibilities and compensation levels of our executive officers and directors
and has not deemed it necessary to impose a holding period requirement for shares owned by our executive officers and directors. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">All NEOs and directors who have
been in their positions for five or more years have met or exceeded the applicable stock ownership guideline. </P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">All recipients of Company equity-based awards,
which include key employees and all officers and directors, are subject to our policy against options trading and short sales of ITW stock, as well as trading in derivatives linked to Company stock. In addition, since April 2013, our employees
(including NEOs) and non-employee directors are prohibited from pledging Company stock. </P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Compensation Recovery Policy
</I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">We maintain a Compensation Recovery Policy (a &#147;clawback policy&#148;) applicable to all executive officers of the Company subject to
Section&nbsp;16 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. Under the policy, the Committee will seek reimbursement of incentives paid to executive officers where the payment was predicated upon the achievement of certain financial results with respect
to the applicable performance period that were subsequently the subject of a material restatement due to material non-compliance of the Company with any financial reporting requirement under the U.S. securities laws. The reimbursement amount is
equal to the excess of the gross incentive payment made over the gross payment that would have been made if the original payment had been determined based on the restated financial results. Further, following a material restatement of our financial
statements, we will seek reimbursement of compensation and profits from trading in Company stock received by our CEO and CFO to the extent required under Section&nbsp;304 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">36 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><FONT COLOR="#821928"><B><I>Deductibility </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;162(m) limits the deductibility of compensation in excess of $1,000,000 paid to the NEOs. Performance-based compensation, as defined
in the regulations under Section&nbsp;162(m), is exempt from this limit. In 2011, our stockholders approved the 2011 Cash Incentive Plan to provide a means to pay performance-based short and long-term incentive cash compensation that qualifies for
the exemption under Section&nbsp;162(m). Executives whose compensation may be subject to the limits of 162(m) initially receive annual and long-term cash incentive awards pursuant to the 2011 Cash Incentive Plan subject to performance goals designed
to comply with the requirements of Section&nbsp;162(m). The Committee then exercises its negative discretion to adjust the awards to the level of bonus calculated pursuant to the performance goals set in connection with the underlying bonus
programs, described above under &#147;Annual Executive Incentive Plan&#148; and &#147;Long-Term Incentives &#150; 2015 Long-Term Incentive Cash Awards.&#148; This procedure better enables the Company to assure the deductibility of the annual and
long-term cash performance incentive payments. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">One of the requirements under 162(m) is that the material terms of the performance goals under the 2011 Cash
Incentive Plan be re-approved by stockholders every five years. The Company is therefore asking that its stockholders re-approve the material terms of the performance goals under the 2011 Cash Incentive Plan at the 2016 Annual Meeting. See
&#147;Proposal 5&#151;Re-Approval of the Material Terms of the Performance Goals under the Illinois Tool Works Inc. 2011 Cash Incentive Plan for Purposes of Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.&#148; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Committee recognizes its obligation to reward performance that increases stockholder value and retains the flexibility in its discretion to award compensation that
does not qualify for the 162(m) exemption if it believes that to be in the best interests of stockholders. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">37 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

amount of deferrals in 2015 for each NEO can be found in footnote 1 to the table under &#147;ITW Retirement Plans - Nonqualified Deferred Compensation&#148; below. The amount of deferrals under the ECRIP in 2014 and 2013 can be found in footnote 4
to the same table. ECRIP deferrals in 2015 of non-equity incentive plan amounts earned in 2015 were as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Santi, $299,442; Mr.&nbsp;Larsen, $213,499; Mr.&nbsp;Parry, $176,340; Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Herlihy, $427,276; and Mr.&nbsp;Martel,

2015, 2014 and 2013. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(4)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">These amounts include an amount of interest in the applicable calendar year considered to be in excess of market rates credited to the deferred compensation accounts of the NEOs under the ECRIP, discussed in more detail
under &#147;Nonqualified Deferred Compensation&#148; below. When a participant attains retirement eligibility at age 55 and 10 years of service, any amounts in his or her ECRIP account deferred prior to January&nbsp;1, 2010 are entitled to a return
of 130% of the monthly Moody&#146;s Corporate Bond Yield Average rate, and the excess interest portion is deemed to be amounts exceeding 100% of such rate. This additional interest credit applies to all eligible plan participants, not just the NEOs.
All amounts deferred after December&nbsp;31, 2009 accrue interest at 100% of the Moody&#146;s Rate. The individual amounts of pension benefits and excess interest credits are shown in the table below. </TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL" ALIGN="center">38 </P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:3%; margin-right:9%; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><I>**Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Herlihy participated in the ITW Retirement Accumulation Plan from 1989 through 1999. From 1999 through August 2011,
he was employed in Ireland, participated in the ITW Irish Pension Plan and ceased active participation in the U.S. plan. Upon his return to the U.S. in 2011, he was ineligible to actively participate in the U.S. plan due to the plan participation
closure effective January&nbsp;1, 2007. The reduction in the Present Value of Accumulated Benefits reflects the economic adjustment in the value of his benefits. </I></P> <P STYLE="font-size:9pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
